dijordan.model

Class Pyramid

  • java.lang.Object
    • ks.common.model.Element
      • dijordan.model.Pyramid

  • public class Pyramid
extends Element
    Models a Pyramid of cards which has rows with increasing numbers of cards in each row

    NOTE: Only once card (row,pos) can be selected at any given time.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Pyramid()
      Construct a Pyramid with the default of 7 rows and a generated name
      Pyramid(int numRows)
      Construct a Pyramid given a number of rows and with a generated name
      Pyramid(int numRows, java.lang.String name)
      Construct a Pyramid given a number of rows and a name
      Pyramid(java.lang.String name)
      Construct a Pyramid given a name with the default of 7 rows

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addCard(PositionCard pc)
      Adds a PositionCard to the pyramid returns false if there is already a card there
      int countCards()
      Returns number of cards in pyramid
      int countRows()
      Returns the number of rows in pyramid
      void deal(Deck d)
      Deal a pyramid
      void deselect()
      Makes all cards in the pyramid not selected
      boolean empty()
      Determines if pyramid is empty
      PositionCard getCard(int row, int position)
      Returns a card by row and position and removes it from the pyramid
      PositionCard getSelected()
      Returns the selected card and removes it from the pyramid (or null if none selected).
      boolean isCardThere(int row, int position)
      Determines if there is a card at a row and position
      boolean isCovered(int row, int position)
      determines if a card at row and position is covered
      boolean isCovered(PositionCard pc)
      determines if a card at row and position is covered
      boolean isSelected()
      Determines if there is a selected card in the pyramid
      PositionCard peekCard(int row, int position)
      Returns a card by row and position, does not remove it If the card is not there, it returns null
      PositionCard peekSelected()
      Returns selected card without removing it (or null if none is selected).
      boolean select(int row, int position)
      Selects a card by row and position Returns true if card is selected, false if not
      java.lang.String toString()
      print name as string
